e0ba2394-6f66-4b19-afbe-6f133288c730.description: The earner of this badge certifies professional development in learner-centered, backward design using Dee Fink’s Strategies for Significant Learning framework. The earner will be the University faculty and staff who attend the Biggio Center’s summer intensive workshop and apply backward design strategies to create a learner-centered course using evidenced-based strategies to be taught the following academic year.
e0ba2394-6f66-4b19-afbe-6f133288c730.name: Course (Re)Design Badge

badge_template_activities.title: Attend all parts of the workshop
Submit a pre-CRD syllabus for assessment. Submit a post-CRD syllabus for assessment

1ad058cd-71b0-4211-8875-97c4572dfa4b.description: The earner of this badge has completed the Career Ready program. The earner is able to articulate attributes and career goals that will help them with future work effectiveness. In addition to resume development and interviewing skills, the earner understands how work habits, integrity and ethical behavior all contribute to career success.
1ad058cd-71b0-4211-8875-97c4572dfa4b.name: Career Ready

badge_template_activities.title: “The attainment and demonstration of requisite competencies that broadly prepare college graduates for a successful transition into the workplace” (National Association of Colleges and Employers, 2016). Earners complete a seven-module Canvas course that engages them in the following skills from a career-readiness perspective: leadership, technology, teamwork, communication, professionalism, career ownership, cross-cultural fluency, and critical thinking.

106dd5bf-5eb8-4d5d-9ccc-30620766ce40.description: The earner of this badge will be able to learn and discuss topics that affect entrepreneurial skills. The Tiger Cage Youth Entrepreneurship Program (Jr. Tiger Cage), provides a comprehensive curriculum including training in concept development, design and marketing of student created products, and business creation. This course and training are designed for students to become more aware of entrepreneurship and business markets.
106dd5bf-5eb8-4d5d-9ccc-30620766ce40.name: Entrepreneurial Skills Training

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, the student must complete the Tiger Cage Youth Entrepreneurship Program (Jr. Tiger Cage).

64af38de-4ed3-4783-b77d-6b73ed0f7771.description: The earner of this badge certifies excellence in the completion of the Preparing Future Faculty course at Auburn University. The earner will be the graduate student who demonstrate a commitment to excellence by performing beyond the minimum requirements of the course.
64af38de-4ed3-4783-b77d-6b73ed0f7771.name: Distinguished Future Faculty

badge_template_activities.title: GTAs who attend all required class sessions and professional development events each semester

7cfd9336-3f4e-42dc-9058-d07b4a557f01.description: The earner of this badge will be able to learn and discuss topics that affect employability skills which include but are not limited to speaking skills, professional dress, personal presentation, professional expression, decision making and problem solving, self-motivation, and youth leadership. This course and training is designed for students to become more employable upon completion and presentable for post high school attainable goals and opportunities. Skills: Employability, Leadership,
7cfd9336-3f4e-42dc-9058-d07b4a557f01.name: Elocution Academy & Employability Skills

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge, the student must complete the Elocution Academy & Employability Skills course and training.

aa32b622-f642-47f3-95a9-6d7f0d5fa953.description: The earner of this badge will be able to learn and discuss topics that affect global communication skills. The earner of this badge will attend the Culture Bump Global Communication Skills Training course, resulting in an internationally recognized certificate in cross-cultural communication.
aa32b622-f642-47f3-95a9-6d7f0d5fa953.name: Global Communication Skills Training

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the student must complete the course/training.

364ffdb3-413b-48cc-b5eb-2af6b7f25f85.description: The earner of this badge will be the faculty member who participate in four or more hours of Biggio Center development with a focus on redesigning classes for student success in Engaged & Active Student Learning (EASL) Classrooms. The earner certifies both participation in an EASL development program as well as a meaningful application of the content by the faculty as evidenced in redesigned course materials, class activities, and/or metacognitive reflections.
364ffdb3-413b-48cc-b5eb-2af6b7f25f85.name: EASL Certified, Level 1

badge_template_activities.title: Attend four or more hours of Biggio Center faculty development. Only Auburn faculty are eligible to earn this badge.

e403a686-2e55-4097-a70c-cfccd316868a.description: The earner of this badge has completed training in creating an effective hybrid learning experience for their students. The earner is able to design a learning experience that replaces seat time with online activities that make more efficient and effective use of the remaining time in the classroom.
e403a686-2e55-4097-a70c-cfccd316868a.name: Certified Hybrid Classroom Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the workshop.
Submit a portfolio and pass the course assessment.

0408a54b-3c13-485d-938f-2fd85e235e39.description: The earner of this badge has continued to work towards essential concepts you will need to get started in teaching online by first preparing you to enhance your face-to-face course with a few online components.
0408a54b-3c13-485d-938f-2fd85e235e39.name: Certified Web-Enhanced Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the module in Canvas.

01c9e583-da21-4f25-a684-994f14070a88.description: The earner of this badge will learn about financial literacy through seminars provided by Regions Bank. AUSPP will provide interactive programs, workshops and curriculum delivered by a financial literacy expert to support financial skill building. These experts will provide basic banking knowledge for students, relevant to the present day as well as financial planning for the future. Presentations, interactive games, and resources will be provided for financial foundation building.
01c9e583-da21-4f25-a684-994f14070a88.name: Financial Literacy

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the student must complete the course/training.

051dee4b-0e52-416d-99d5-613777c5233d.description: The earner of this badge has continued to work toward online teaching preparation by ensuring they know the design principles and quality standards, as well as best practices in online instruction to facilitate a successful course wholly online. The earner understands the online course approval process and well as the credit hour guidelines and Quality Standards.
051dee4b-0e52-416d-99d5-613777c5233d.name: Certified Online Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the module in Canvas.

f406f964-114b-4ff2-aefe-6130e6c3ac1c.description: The Culture Bump: Cross Cultural Training - Complete Course badge is one of a series of courses offered in collaboration with AU Outreach through the Center for Educational Outreach and Engagement (CEOE). The earner of this badge has completed all six modules of Culture Bump training and will be able to identify and describe "culture bumps" and their universal characteristics. The earner will be able to describe expectations and manage emotional responses to "culture bumps".
f406f964-114b-4ff2-aefe-6130e6c3ac1c.name: Culture Bump: Cross Cultural Training - Complete Course

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: complete all modules within the Culture Bump training program.

a8576ec1-7070-4b8e-8b06-7294a0e1d10e.description: The Survey of Faculty Engagement is a first task in a series of community engaged scholar and professional education programs offered by the AU (Auburn University) Outreach Office of Faculty Engagement. In completion of the survey, the earner of this badge will report that they have engaged in outreach and/or extension activity.
a8576ec1-7070-4b8e-8b06-7294a0e1d10e.name: Community Engaged Faculty Badge (CEF I)

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: Complete the Survey of Public Faculty Engagement
To earn this badge the person must: Report of outreach activity or established Community Engagement program

0e1d5dce-0e66-4c80-8629-c22f4e81a18e.description: The Survey of Faculty Engagement is a first task in a series of community engaged scholar and professional education programs offered by the AU (Auburn University) Outreach Office of Faculty Engagement. In completion of the survey, the earner of this badge will report they have engaged in outreach and/or extension activity and/or coordinated programs and report a faculty appointment allocation of time (percentage) in outreach.
0e1d5dce-0e66-4c80-8629-c22f4e81a18e.name: Community Engaged Faculty Badge (CEF II)

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: Complete the Survey of Public Faculty Engagement
To earn this badge the person must: Report of a departmental Faculty Outreach and Engaged appointment allocation of time
To earn this badge the person must: Report of outreach activity or established Community Engagement program

f6bb1fa4-e1a5-41f5-9ed7-5c9a4dc4a6ce.description: The Community Leadership for a Changing Economy badge is one of a series of Community Partner Training programs offered by the AU Outreach Office of Public Service for faculty, students, and people with non-profit and civic organizations. The earner will be able to understand how the current economic climate can affect their operations. They will also be able to identify and apply tips and strategies for responding to economic challenges.
f6bb1fa4-e1a5-41f5-9ed7-5c9a4dc4a6ce.name: Community Partner Training Badge 1: Community Leadership for a Changing Economy

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: review the Community Leadership for a Changing Economy video and complete assessment in the post-video survey with a 90% accuracy

94091e58-f2ba-465f-b1f8-9c340f7b3389.description: The Board Member Recruitment and Development course is one of a series of Community Partner Training programs offered by the AU Outreach Office of Public Service. Non-profit organizations rely on the leadership and guidance of board members to function efficiently and effectively, and to deliver critical programs and services. Recruiting and training effective board members is an important step in maintaining and growing healthy organizations.
94091e58-f2ba-465f-b1f8-9c340f7b3389.name: Community Partner Training Badge 7: Board Member Recruitment and Development

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: review the Board Member Recruitment and Development video and complete assessment in the post-video survey with a 90% accuracy

c033c113-987f-49d5-b235-e06f2b886661.description: The earner of this badge will be the faculty member who participate in the two course facilitation workshops “Motivation and Metacognition” & “Team Based Learning: Feedback and Assessment” offered by the Biggio Center. The earner certifies both participation in the EASL Level 2 development programs as well as a meaningful application of the content by the faculty as evidenced in redesigned course materials, class activities, and/or metacognitive reflections.
c033c113-987f-49d5-b235-e06f2b886661.name: EASL Certified, Level 2

badge_template_activities.title: Only Auburn University faculty and GTAs are eligible to earn this badge.

e97ba99f-5942-4696-940a-a5757ec9567f.description: The Survey of Faculty Engagement is a first task in a series of community engaged scholar and professional education programs offered by the AU (Auburn University) Outreach Office of Faculty Engagement. In completion of the survey, the earner of this badge will report they have engaged in outreach activity and/or coordinated programs, report a faculty appointment allocation of time (percentage) in outreach and/or extension, and report outreach publication(s) and/or grants.
e97ba99f-5942-4696-940a-a5757ec9567f.name: Community Engaged Faculty Badge (CEF III)

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: Complete the Survey of Public Faculty Engagement
To earn this badge the person must: Report of a departmental Faculty Outreach and Engaged appointment allocation of time
To earn this badge the person must: Report of outreach activity or established Community Engagement program
To earn this badge the person must: Report outreach publication(s) and/or grant(s)

d877f896-3b14-461a-8c5d-411c2494effa.description: The Grant Writing Workshop is one of a series of Community Partner Training programs offered by the AU Outreach Office of Public Service. This workshop consists of two, 1-hour sessions that will cover the nuts and bolts of the grant preparation and the submission process and writing a convincing grant: what and how to convey your idea to the sponsor you are requesting funds from.
d877f896-3b14-461a-8c5d-411c2494effa.name: Community Partner Training Badge 5: Grant Writing Basics, Part 1

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: review the Grant Writing Basics, part 1 video and complete assessment in the post-video survey with a 90% accuracy

38a53527-c37d-4f0e-9311-415b4fc26b9a.description: The Grant Writing Workshop is one of a series of Community Partner Training programs offered by the AU Outreach Office of Public Service. This workshop consists of two, 1-hour sessions that will cover the nuts and bolts of the grant preparation and the submission process and writing a convincing grant: what and how to convey your idea to the sponsor you are requesting funds from.
38a53527-c37d-4f0e-9311-415b4fc26b9a.name: Community Partner Training Badge 6: Grant Writing Basics, Part 2

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: review the Grant Writing Basics, part 2 video and complete assessment in the post-video survey with a 90% accuracy

2484f09e-ee78-4cc2-86a8-ae91f1d8166e.description: The earner of this badge has continued to improve readiness for success in introductory physics by reviewing and practicing mathematical concepts in physical contexts. The earner will learn the concepts of graphing, solving systems of equations, and vectors. NOTE: This is a dual-enrollment resource intended to be used in conjunction with the lecture and lab during the first two two weeks of the introductory physics course.
2484f09e-ee78-4cc2-86a8-ae91f1d8166e.name: PHYS 1403

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Math to Physics PHYS 1403 course.

b501bd74-0769-4308-9376-adef65ba45c0.description: The earner of this badge has completed training in designing and implementing a quality online course. They have proven the ability to put theory into practice. The earner can create a quality syllabus and a course map that aligns learning outcomes, assessments, activities, content and delivery, and time required of students.
b501bd74-0769-4308-9376-adef65ba45c0.name: Certified Master Online Instructor

badge_template_activities.title: Upon completion of the Learning to Teach Online course, earners submit three of the following four activities: 1) revised syllabus 2) course map that aligns learning outcomes, assessments, activities, content and delivery, and time required of students 3) a formal QM review of the designed online course, or 4) new online course proposal.

d6756c44-9e9a-4982-a0eb-7ff1d0f4efa3.description: The Non-Profit Fundraising in Challenging Times course is one of a series of Community Partner Training programs offered by the AU Outreach Office of Public Service. Fundraising is critical to the success of non-profit organizations, even more so during these unprecedented times. The earner will learn some basic elements of fundraising. The earner will also be able to list some strategies for fundraising in these challenging times.
d6756c44-9e9a-4982-a0eb-7ff1d0f4efa3.name: Community Partner Training Badge 3: Non-Profit Fundraising in Challenging Times

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: review the Non-Profit Fundraising in Challenging Times video and complete assessment in the post-video survey with a 90% accuracy

fc1de576-731c-467c-890e-e0b1421c82c5.description: The Volunteer Recruitment and Engagement course is one of a series of Community Partner Training programs offered by the AU Outreach Office of Public Service. Volunteers are an essential component for any successful non-profit organization. This course will discuss best practices for recruiting and engaging volunteers, with some tips specifically for recruitment and engagement during the current COVID-19 crisis.
fc1de576-731c-467c-890e-e0b1421c82c5.name: Community Partner Training Badge 4: Volunteer Recruitment and Engagement

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: review the Volunteer Recruitment and Engagement video and complete assessment in the post-video survey with a 90% accuracy

3a3175f8-3a25-4b98-bba7-619365ce72a5.description: The earner of this badge will be those who have completed the Enhancing the Afterschool STEM Experience online course that will walk afterschool professionals through the Dimensions of Success (DoS) Tool created by the Pear Institute. The earner will learn the DoS Tool used in afterschool programs across the State of Alabama to ensure that our students are receiving a true, authentic STEM experience in their out.
3a3175f8-3a25-4b98-bba7-619365ce72a5.name: STEM Student Learner

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Enhancing the Afterschool STEM Experience online course.

cdd22b15-8897-477a-a241-40f956e09153.description: The Intern Training & Placement course is one of a series of Community Partner Training programs offered by the AU Outreach Office of Public Service. The earner will develop an understanding of the expectations for an intern and learn about apps for better remote intern management. The earner will also examine their leadership management style and the effect it has on an intern’s work experience.
cdd22b15-8897-477a-a241-40f956e09153.name: Community Partner Training Badge 2: Intern Training & Placement

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: review the Intern Training & Placement video and complete assessment in the post-video survey with a 90% accuracy

7509ce37-0c9a-41c7-b24a-365861b7c271.description: The Culture Bump Module 3: Communication badge is one of a series of courses offered in collaboration with AU Outreach through the Center for Educational Outreach and Engagement (CEOE). The earner of this badge has completed the third module of Culture Bump training and is able to identify various styles of communication. The earner will also be able to clarify the relationship between communication, message, and behavior.
7509ce37-0c9a-41c7-b24a-365861b7c271.name: Culture Bump Module 3: Communication

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: complete the third module (Communication) of the Culture Bump training program.

f4b5e10d-a536-4f37-b9e5-dfc977a661ca.description: The Culture Bump Module 4: Cultural Values badge is one of a series of courses offered in collaboration with AU Outreach through the Center for Educational Outreach and Engagement (CEOE). The earner of this badge has completed the fourth module of Culture Bump training and will be able to distinguish between cultural and individuals values for themselves and others.
f4b5e10d-a536-4f37-b9e5-dfc977a661ca.name: Culture Bump Module 4: Cultural Values

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: complete the fourth module (Cultural Values) of the Culture Bump training program.

4059c5d0-72cf-4341-b714-27cb1ac0bbe1.description: The Culture Bump Module 6: Emotional Intelligence badge is one of a series of courses offered in collaboration with AU Outreach through the Center for Educational Outreach and Engagement (CEOE). The earner of this badge has completed the sixth module of Culture Bump training. The earner will develop strategies for dealing with emotions. They will also develop a higher ability to name their own and other people's emotions.
4059c5d0-72cf-4341-b714-27cb1ac0bbe1.name: Culture Bump Module 6: Emotional Intelligence

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: complete the sixth module (Emotional Intelligence) of the Culture Bump training program.

f34cd9d5-eb0f-406b-85f9-9f9a0fe4b9c2.description: Faculty can earn the AUAI Explorer badge by completing eight tasks, each related to the module content in the AI in Education course. These tasks are designed to help make connections between what content of the course and how to actually use AI in your classroom. Each completed task brings participants one step closer to understanding AI and its implications for teaching and learning in higher education.
f34cd9d5-eb0f-406b-85f9-9f9a0fe4b9c2.name: AI in Education Explorer

badge_template_activities.title: The primary goal of this course is to support faculty in thinking through the urgent and important questions that the AI disruption in education presents and to create opportunities for you to learn from and with each other so that you are confident in the design of your courses and in supporting your students as we navigate this shifting landscape together.

1671de37-87d3-459f-a046-5b67e3746fd8.description: The Culture Bump Module 1: Perceptions badge is one of a series of courses offered in collaboration with AU Outreach through the Center for Educational Outreach and Engagement (CEOE). The earner of this badge has completed the first module of Culture Bump training and is able to identify their perceptions and the fact that they are different from other people's perceptions. The earner will be able to identify common situations underlying differing perceptions.
1671de37-87d3-459f-a046-5b67e3746fd8.name: Culture Bump Module 1: Perceptions

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: complete the first module (Perceptions) of the Culture Bump training program.

302832c0-1ef5-485a-a23f-8132a28e41d8.description: The Culture Bump Module 2: Culture Bumps badge is one of a series of courses offered in collaboration with AU Outreach through the Center for Educational Outreach and Engagement (CEOE). The earner of this badge has completed the second module of Culture Bump training and is able to identify specific cultural differences or "culture bumps". The earner will be able to identify their own culture bumps as well as recognizing common human themes embedded in every culture bump.
302832c0-1ef5-485a-a23f-8132a28e41d8.name: Culture Bump Module 2: Culture Bumps

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: complete the second module (Culture Bumps) of the Culture Bump training program.

8dee24d9-dbf2-45fd-a441-7273f3bfb1e5.description: The Culture Bump Module 5: Commonalities badge is one of a series of courses offered in collaboration with AU Outreach through the Center for Educational Outreach and Engagement (CEOE). The earner of this badge has completed the fifth module of Culture Bump training. The earner will be able to identify the two types of commonalities that we share as humans: university qualities and universal situations.
8dee24d9-dbf2-45fd-a441-7273f3bfb1e5.name: Culture Bump Module 5: Commonalities

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: complete the fifth module (Commonalities) of the Culture Bump training program.

f9fcd27b-1b46-42c9-98aa-5b1b1734ea21.description: The Culture Bump Module 7: Cultural Adjustment badge is one of a series of courses offered in collaboration with AU Outreach through the Center for Educational Outreach and Engagement (CEOE). The earner of this badge has completed module 7 of the Culture Bump training. The earner will learn how to spot where they are in the Adjustment Cycle. They will also learn what to do to help transition well into new situations and cultures.
f9fcd27b-1b46-42c9-98aa-5b1b1734ea21.name: Culture Bump Module 7: Cultural Adjustment

badge_template_activities.title: To earn this badge the person must: complete module 7 (Cultural Adjustment) of the Culture Bump training program.

f8dc3e44-93ba-472c-be0a-1cafb018a79f.description: This badge is awarded to participants who complete training on how to become an ally who helps to build a safe and healthy workplace and learning environment.
f8dc3e44-93ba-472c-be0a-1cafb018a79f.name: Discrimination and Harassment Prevention Training

badge_template_activities.title: This is the first of two modules focused on how Auburn University’s Policy Against Discrimination and Harassment protects students, employees, and third parties from discrimination and harassment as well as how we all can reflect on our own behavior and help make Auburn University a community of respect and inclusion.

be605fd0-eed0-4dd2-abfc-815d8f2fc966.description: This badge is awarded to participants who complete training on how Auburn University's Title IX and Discrimination policies protect students, employees, and third parties from sexual and gender-based harassment and sexual misconduct.
be605fd0-eed0-4dd2-abfc-815d8f2fc966.name: Identifying and Responding to Sexual Misconduct Training

badge_template_activities.title: By the end of this course, Participants should be able to: 1) recognize sexual or gender-based harassment, 2) identify the seven main types of sexual harassment, and 3) describe how to report sexual misconduct to the Title IX Coordinator or a Deputy Title IX Coordinator.

861037bb-63f3-416d-94b1-5aaca8b6a263.description: This badge is awarded to participants who complete training on ways to foster an environment in which people experience connection, community, respect, and involvement.
861037bb-63f3-416d-94b1-5aaca8b6a263.name: Inclusion and Belonging in a Diverse Community Training

badge_template_activities.title: This is the second of two modules focused on how Auburn University’s Policy Against Discrimination and Harassment protects students, employees, and third parties from discrimination and harassment as well as how we all can reflect on our own behavior and help make Auburn University a community of respect and inclusion.

afa30891-7376-46a2-8d35-d0674ab79267.description: The holder of this badge has been recognized as a Master Teacher. They are able to apply classroom management strategies that benefit ....
afa30891-7376-46a2-8d35-d0674ab79267.name: Master Teacher

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the entire series of EDUC 600 level courses.
Submit and have reviewed a portfolio of evidence of master teaching practices.

0ff0092f-d1eb-47f6-8616-e61e4781901c.description: This earner of this badge will be able to discuss topics that affect farmers and ranchers, including the following: Family members working for each other on farm or ranch, including the reinstated kiddie tax rules; Farm or ranch employer-provided meals and lodging; Special use valuation; Depreciation of farm property; Self-employment tax on agricultural activities
0ff0092f-d1eb-47f6-8616-e61e4781901c.name: Online Tax Seminar: Agricultural and Natural Resource Tax Issues - 1 CPE

badge_template_activities.title: After watching the course video, the earner completed an assessment with a score of 75% or better.

7930ed81-bc77-43ef-a9dc-c510babefc63.description: This earner of this badge will be able to review new partnership reporting requirements and discuss the taxation of section 501(c)(7) social clubs and 501(c)(10) fraternal organizations, including eligibility for exemption, record-keeping and reporting requirements, and income tax issues.
7930ed81-bc77-43ef-a9dc-c510babefc63.name: Online Tax Seminar: Business Entities Tax Issues - 1 CPE

badge_template_activities.title: After watching the course video, the earner completed an assessment with a score of 75% or better.

7e2664ff-3215-42a5-a23f-1a56519d1654.description: This earner of this badge will be able to discuss some of the issues that tax practitioners encounter when they prepare returns for clients who operate a business. Topics include the following: Tax issues for a taxpayer engaged in a multi-level marketing business; Opportunity zones; Bonus depreciation; New health reimbursement arrangements for small businesses
7e2664ff-3215-42a5-a23f-1a56519d1654.name: Online Tax Seminar: Business Tax Issues - 1 CPE

badge_template_activities.title: After watching the course video, the earner completed an assessment with a score of 75% or better.

255b386e-4ee1-4cf7-8324-50f8535a0687.description: This earner of this badge will be able to discuss issues that help tax practitioners comply with their ethical obligations. Topics include the following: Due diligence for a tax practitioner who helps a self-employed taxpayer claim the earned income credit; Best practices in making and accepting referrals, including referrals from an online referral service; When a tax practitioner can disclose information through the IRS Whistleblower Program; Ethical considerations for tax practitioners.
255b386e-4ee1-4cf7-8324-50f8535a0687.name: Online Tax Seminar: Ethics - 2 CPE

badge_template_activities.title: After watching the course video, the earner completed an assessment with a score of 75% or better.

a372762b-bce0-4253-b5b1-f93698231b6b.description: This earner of this badge will be able to discuss the tax consequences of foreclosures, repossessions, and abandonments and explains when cancellation of indebtedness must be included in income and when it can be excluded. Comprehensive examples of the reduction in tax attributes that must occur when cancelled debt is excluded from income. Bad debt deduction for business and nonbusiness bad debts.
a372762b-bce0-4253-b5b1-f93698231b6b.name: Online Tax Seminar: Financial Distress Tax Issues - 1 CPE

badge_template_activities.title: After watching the course video, the earner completed an assessment with a score of 75% or better.

c813d443-f48e-4be0-bcc5-835c2dc3fcaa.description: This earner of this badge will be able to discuss several issues tax practitioners encounter when preparing individual income tax returns, including the following: Deductions for health insurance and other health expenses; Casualty losses and gains; Deductions, credits, and exclusions for education; Who can claim the child tax credit, credit for other dependents, education credits, and other individual income tax credits.
c813d443-f48e-4be0-bcc5-835c2dc3fcaa.name: Online Tax Seminar: Individual Tax Issues - 2 CPE

badge_template_activities.title: After watching the course video, the earner completed an assessment with a score of 75% or better.

1df0c2fe-74b9-43e7-accc-e37344506b91.description: This earner of this badge will be able to discuss issues the IRS targets as key issues for practitioners. Topics include the following: Cybersecurity; Virtual currency; IRS Withholding Estimator; Taxation of the gig economy; IRS information sources.
1df0c2fe-74b9-43e7-accc-e37344506b91.name: Online Tax Seminar: IRS Tax Issues Update - 1 CPE

1e9db1ae-e510-47e0-8e1a-c15524b59ab6.description: This earner of this badge will be able to discuss recently enacted tax legislation and procedures, including comprehensive coverage of the tax provisions in the Families First Coronavirus Response Act and the Coronavirus Aid, Relief, and Economic Security (CARES) Act.
1e9db1ae-e510-47e0-8e1a-c15524b59ab6.name: Online Tax Seminar: New and Expiring Tax Issues - 2 CPE

badge_template_activities.title: After watching the course video, the earner completed an assessment with a score of 75% or better.

skills.name: Coronavirus Aid Relief And Economic Security (CARES) Act

85af7c19-240f-435c-a992-e843f72ad915.description: This earner of this badge will be able to discuss select issues related to the section 199A deduction. Explain how to calculate the qualified business income (QBI) deduction and the limitations on the deduction. Also explains when trades or businesses can be aggregated, how to net and carryover QBI losses, and when a taxpayer can claim the QBI deduction for rental real estate income.
85af7c19-240f-435c-a992-e843f72ad915.name: Online Tax Seminar: Qualified Business Income Tax Issues - 2 CPE

21df3fdf-0ff5-4c4a-bc97-8ecaefa5e4d8.description: This earner of this badge will be able to discuss required minimum distributions, IRA beneficiary designations, early distributions, qualified charitable distributions, and investments.
21df3fdf-0ff5-4c4a-bc97-8ecaefa5e4d8.name: Online Tax Seminar: Retirement and Investment Issues - 1 CPE

badge_template_activities.title: After watching the course video, the earner completed an assessment with a score of 75% or better.

510c45be-e69c-44e6-b995-81d7905682b0.description: This earner of this badge will be able to discuss important tax issues for S corporations, including the choice of entity rules and the S corporation election. Explains issues that the IRS has identified in its compliance campaigns, including S corporation distributions, the built-in-gains tax, and S corporation loss limitations. This chapter also includes an explanation of calculating basis and required basis reporting on Schedule E (Form 1040).
510c45be-e69c-44e6-b995-81d7905682b0.name: Online Tax Seminar: S Corp Tax Issues - 1 CPE

badge_template_activities.title: After watching the course video, the earner completed an assessment with a score of 75% or better.

skills.name: Important Tax Issues For S Corporations

5ab55d18-d8e7-4974-adb3-04d609b1424e.description: This earner of this badge will be able to discuss estate planning to preserve the increased exemption amount before it expires at the end of 2025. The earner will review the definition of a gift, use of the annual gift tax exclusion, and when it is necessary to file a gift tax return. Explains how a tax practitioner can identify different types of trusts, and how those trusts report income tax to their beneficiaries.
5ab55d18-d8e7-4974-adb3-04d609b1424e.name: Online Tax Seminar: Trust and Estate Issues - 1 CPE
